intro: Crotalaria quinquefolia, commonly known as the five-leaved crotalaria, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring palmately divided leaves with five leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in spikes, and it produces oblong, ridged seed pods. Crotalaria quinquefolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
